topics.title: Clap Switch
topics.description: Creating a clap switch or sound triggered LED circuit.
evidence_quotes: So normally the voltage at the trigger pin will be near to positive voltage and it drops whenever you clap which triggers the monostable circuit and so the LED should glow.

topics.title: Monostable Circuit
topics.description: Using a 555 timer IC to create a monostable circuit.
evidence_quotes: What this arrangement does is, whenever the trigger pin detects a drop in voltage, the 555 timer turns on the output for a duration determined by the value of capacitor and resistor.

topics.title: Primary Circuit
topics.description: The primary circuit used in the sound triggered LED application.
evidence_quotes: As we don't require LED at the output of a primary circuit, I am removing it along with its series resistor.

topics.title: Secondary Circuit
topics.description: The secondary circuit used in the sound triggered LED application.
evidence_quotes: This resistor acts as a load for the second transistor as well as keeps the output high when the transistor is not turned on.

topics.title: Trigger Pin
topics.description: The trigger pin and its role in the monostable circuit.
evidence_quotes: Now it's time to couple output of a primary circuit with the trigger pin of this mono stable circuit.
